title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1: INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2024, multisector committees (CNMN ) at national and in at least 6 provinces coordinate the design, budgeting, and review and monitoring of national policies and strategies governing the nutritional services and care practices., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Early Childhood Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children (0â€“5 years), adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women benefit from improved feeding, nutrition services and practices, including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, multisector committees (CNMN ) at national and in at least 6 provinces coordinate the design, budgeting, and review; and monitoring of national policies and strategies governing the nutritional services and care practices.

[Number of investment cases produced to inform a sufficient and increased budget line for nutrition] Nombre de dossiers d'investissement produits pour informer une ligne budgtaire suffisante et accrue pour la nutrition.

[Number of multisector nutrition action plans that are budgeted for and tracked at the provincial and national level] Nombre de plans d'action multisectoriels pour la nutrition budgtiss et suivis dans les provinces et au niveau national.
[Number of provincial multi-sectoral committees on nutrition that are functional] Nombre de comits multisectoriels provinciaux sur la nutrition qui sont fonctionnels
Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
Country has a budgeted plan to eliminate water and fluids to support increase in exclusive breastfeeding
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
